website_summaries.verdict: Current Samsung smartphone available from most major cellphone carriers.
pros: Large screen is bright and easy to see
Weatherproofing makes the exterior water resistant to splashes and rain
cons: Limited speech-to-text and text-to-speech capabilities with the built-in voice commands

website_summaries.verdict: This high-end, feature-rich phone may be expensive, but you'll truly get what you pay for.
pros: The camera is phenomenal, with features that allow for great low-light images, faster processing, and unparalleled creativity
The battery life is elite, there's wireless charging, and the full-body display is as high-res as they come
cons: Some users complain about connectivity issues when it comes to reception and WiFi

customer_reviews.title: No phone in the box!
customer_reviews.text: The box I received didn't have a phone in it!!! instead, it had a cheap plastic phone case. Also, the box had no seal on it so it could have been tampered with at any point. I watched "unboxing" videos for this phone, and there's supposed to be a sticker seal you have to break to open the box. From other reviews, it sounds like other customers have received empty boxes or dummy phones. Customer service is processing a replacement. Hopefully that goes alright. I'll update the review when I have more info on the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Deklotz

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Was not given the actual phone. Only a display model with no hardware, screen, camera, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Martinez-Areas

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on Verizon network
customer_reviews.text: Took the phone to the Verizon store and was told that it was incompatible with their network. Don't waste your time with this if you have Verizon.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Vendor messed up the order twice
customer_reviews.text: Note, when you purchase this product the name beneath the title of the product is the manufacturer name NOT the vendor! Not only was the phone I received different than the one I ordered but they also did not include a charging cable with the product. Don't let them fool you, these phones are NOT new, and they are NOT being sold by Samsung. Do yourself a favor and just go to Best Buy instead.
customer_reviews.author: matthew.fuglsang@case.edu

customer_reviews.title: Some down sides but recommended
customer_reviews.text: Has the typical OEM bloatware as well as some Google and third-party software that can't be removed. The hardware Bixby button is an obvious attempt at overriding Google assistant. It's very easy to activate unintentionally. A Samsung account is necessary to use their competing features; even some that don't make sense to need an account. The screen is brilliant and beautiful. The curved edges give it an attractive illusion of depth. Battery life is very good and recharge is very fast. Samsung has the best swipe and predictive qwerty of all brands I've owned. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: veranet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived earlier than expected, everything was included in the box, works 100%, everything thing it was said and expected to be. This phone is worth buying.

customer_reviews.title: Sprint customer
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for the kids. We went to a Sprint store to get them activated and switched over from the old phones. Both needed a sim card installed, only 5 bucks each so no big deal there. These S9's were upgrades from our S6 and Note5 which did not use sim cards. They have both been in use for a few weeks now and I have not heard any complaints. They look nice and the battery seems to last all day if fully charged. Buying them on Amazon means no re-upping my Sprint contract, which is good because I prefer to minimize my commitments to any contract.
customer_reviews.author: 208Bronco

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone not too long ago. It started by turning off even though it had more than 50%. I didn't think much of it until it got really hot and I took the case off and noticed it was cracking in the back. It almost burst in my hand. After I felt it was safe I opened the back and the battery was punctured. I am super disappointed as this was supposed to be a good phone, and have been checked throughout and they failed to do that. I will not be buying again and do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Sprint!
customer_reviews.text: This phone was not compatible with Sprint network. We spent half our day at 2 different Sprint stores in an attempt to activate this phone. I also purchased a otterbox case and screen protector which I am losing $15 on becuase seller is charging me for the return.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Renker

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad to activate as a Verizon phone. It is NOT the same phone you'd get at Verizon. He spent so much time calling Samsung and they told him this- This phone will not have the identical capabilities as what you'd buy at Verizon. Specifically, the video call feature with another Android, and will not using WiFi for calls if you don't have cell service. These are TWO big things that doesn't make sense to go without when you pay this much for a phone. SO upset.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn

customer_reviews.title: Rip off.
customer_reviews.text: I AM SO ANGRY. I GOT A "DUMMY" PHONE IT DOES NOT EVEN WANT TO TURN ON AND THE BEST PART IS IT ISN'T EVEN A SAMSUNG S9. I BROUGHT THIS PHONE WITH ME TO AUSTRALIA AS A GIFT FOR MY DAD AND I AM FURIOUS ONLY TO OPEN THE BOX AND GET THIS PHONE. I WANT MY MONEY BACK.
customer_reviews.author: gertie

customer_reviews.title: Great phone so far
customer_reviews.text: I have just received it, and it’s great that there’s an option to transfer data onto it from other phones, including my iPhone SE. Other reviews claimed that there was no phone in the box, or accessories were missing. This made me a bit skeptical and worried, but I’m glad I took the gamble. A beautiful phone, and the infinity screen makes it more beautiful. Fingerprint scanner is an a very efficient place and takes less than 3 seconds to set up. I will be back with another review in a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: KaraJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice, clean, brand new phone
customer_reviews.text: I was so nervous about getting this phone after reading some of the reviews, but I'm happy to say I've had it almost a month so far and still no complaints. I use verizon towers through straight talk and had no issue setting it up myself. It is all glass so I recommend a nice case and screen protector. The camera is amazing and the set up is really nice. I also loved that it didn't come with all the random apps that I never used on my old phones.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Broke Within a Year.  Not Worth the Price Savings . . .
customer_reviews.text: Picked up an unlocked S9 on Amazon last year during a sale. The price was too good to pass up. Looked and packaged like a legit factory Samsung phone. All was well until last week - the microphone died. Nobody could hear me unless I was on speaker phone. Forget the warranty. Repair was costly. Replaced it with an S10 bought at my local T-Mobile store. No question as to authenticity. The moral of the story: if you want a phone that you KNOW is authentic, works and is backed by warranty . . . buy it from the manufacturer or your carrier. The risk of getting a dodgy phone from Amazon (or any other reseller) isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: VMM

customer_reviews.title: Superb flagship phone.
customer_reviews.text: Best you can get from Samsung currently, comes with everything you would expect from a flagship: UHD AMOLED display, water and dust resistance, wireless charging, iris and fingerprint scanners, fast charging included in the box, headphone jack and a pair of nice AKG earbuds,microSD slot for expanded storage etc. Fast, snappy and stylish. Its Samsung's flagship phone and Iphone's main competition for a reason. the only "bad thing" I would say is that if you already have an S8 then the S9 is not worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Escorcia

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone but with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: This unit ships without WIFI calling features available. I did not do my research and only found out after attempting to turn the feature on. Imagine my disappointment upon learning this on my overseas trip. I have now come to learn that unlocked units not sold by the carriers do not have this feature. It is still a nice phone and I would recommend this if calling with WIFI is not a must-have feature.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian

customer_reviews.title: The phone I received was refurbished not new
customer_reviews.text: Phone having issues with recieving phone call network provider said it's not on there end. IT'S THE PHONE...
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Powell

customer_reviews.title: good phone.
customer_reviews.text: Id really give it 3.5, but thats because I might be a lil biased (I think smart phones are overpriced). great cameras for video and stills, fast on loading apps and tabs, great options with editing photos or videos, fingerprint reader is fast, but would rather have it in screen or on side. also it overheats when I charge it sometimes, especially if Im using it as a mobile hotspot at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: ramon d.

customer_reviews.title: All that wonderful tech ruined by the hideous Bixby button!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful phone, a smooth operator. Fast, slick (literally and figuratively), a fantastically marvelous piece of tech. I have returned this phone because there is this wretched little Bixby button directly OPPOSITE the POWER button, where by squeezing the POWER, I invariably re-activate Bixby, which was disabled per intructions. It could have been such a great phone. Yes, technically I can disable the button IF I sign up for a Samsung account so that I can change the settings in Bixby. Sorry, Samsung, I don't want my phone activities reporting to your mothership.
customer_reviews.author: GeoMac

customer_reviews.title: unlocked means you can't do wifi calling on AT&T and miss many features
customer_reviews.text: Only ATT branded phones have wifi calling and visual voicemail by ATT. DO NOT get unlocked phones if you are on ATT. You will eventually regret it because there are many other features that ATT keeps for their own phones.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii T

customer_reviews.title: Starts to restart or shut off on it own within 3months
customer_reviews.text: I bought the phone in April. It was working fine, battery life good n camera n everything else.. however I realize recently that it starts to restart or shut off on it's own 3 days consecutively now and it's very frustrating.. I've never had a problem like this with Samsung before. I told my friend about the issue and she also said her boyfriend had the same exact problem with his s9.. if I had known maybe I would have bought something else... Some assistance would be greatly appreciated
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used phone advertised as new
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone months ago because I knew I would be needing a new one and the price was great. However when trying to activate found its not NEW but used and has a lock on it. After spending hundreds of dollars this phone is useless. This should not be allowed. Amazon refuses to refund because its past the 30 days return window. Buyer beware of purchasing! I will not continue to do business with Amazon...the buck stops with them as they advertised and sold defective item.
customer_reviews.author: sani44

customer_reviews.title: False Ad
customer_reviews.text: It claimed to be unlocked in the title but when I received it, it only accepted Verizon Wireless
customer_reviews.author: Nora G.

customer_reviews.title: Do buy electrics on line!
customer_reviews.text: This product was a nightmare for me. Even though it said it was unlocked there was an AT&T app hidden on it. I am with Straight Talk and i have always used Verizon. It took two weeks before someone could figure out why my phone had no bars and any call that made it through was cut off or no one could hear anything. All the call I tried wouldn't go through and when the did they did go through the call fell off. Not a true unblocked phone. I will never buy electronics from amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need in a phone
customer_reviews.text: Got this on sale for a good deal and I am impressed with the sound quality, the camera, pretty much everything. I was replacing an S5 so I was a bit behind on the phones. It was easy to set up, I just had to visit my Verizon store and buy a SIM card because the S5 wouldn't work. It was around $10 bucks. Comes with headphones and a handy device that lets you port all of your stuff from your old phone, into the new one. Overall, I am satisfied with this phone, hopefully it lasts me as long as the S5 did!
customer_reviews.author: Steven P.

customer_reviews.title: Puchased this phone on pre-order back in March and have ...
customer_reviews.text: Puchased this phone on pre-order back in March and have been using it since the day I received it on Sprint. I was hesitant to purchase a phone outside of a Sprint store but it worked out well and there was only one hiccup in activating it. This phone does not come with a SIM, which apparently Sprint doesn't always carry in the store. After some searching a SIM was located and the associate switched my phones (S8 to S9) in about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Definitely new not refurbished
customer_reviews.text: This came brand new completely wrapped in plastic down to the sides of the phone. The people complaining about it being used clearly bought from a 3rd party seller. I bought from Amazon and it was definitely the unlocked model that works on cdma and gsm. My wife loves her new phone and the new one ui made it easier to switch from apple. It came with all accessories also wrapped.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Lillis

customer_reviews.title: Amazon, Who is enriching themselves here?
customer_reviews.text: I know my wife will like the phone. I have one. This phone came to me LOCKED. The Tmobile guy said it was a sprint phone. The phone is new but the serial # on the box doesn't match the tag on the phone. At $450 for last year's model, I didn't think I was setting myself up as a victim of fraud.
customer_reviews.author: Mikemike

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving this phone.
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the "single starred" reviews I was getting worried about my purchase. As soon as it booted up though, all my doubts vanished! The phone is so much more better than my old phone! I was using a BLU phone with only 8gbs of internal storage and really wanted an upgrade. And what an upgrade it was! The camera quality is splendid, the performance is remarkable, and the transition was smooth as silk. The battery life is hindered due to the always on function and the already implanted apps that run among Samsung's internal storage,but it doesn't bother me that much. I'm still learning of it's many capabilities, but all in all I'm not disappointed with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod L Eskeets

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy off Amazon is the bottom line.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone for my wife in January. Everything went well for a few months, and then at the end of March the operating system corrupted. Phone cannot be booted into safe mode, recovery mode, or any other option. Save yourself the hassle; buy your phones in-store so you have some recourse for repair or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase experience
customer_reviews.text: Very hesitant to purchase my first unlocked phone, and first time also not buying directly from my carrier, Verizon. But the phone arrived in the amazon warehouse packaging, within the original Samsung packaging, and appears to be brand new. Accessories had never been opened. Phone turned right on and initiated setup, and upon inserting my existing sim card, prompted to download verizon updates and was up and running within seconds. I've had several galaxy phones in the past, so I'm happy with this new upgrade, and pleasantly surprised by the money saved in buying Like New from Amazon Warehouse, as opposed to to buying directly from Verizon. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: AC Lew

customer_reviews.title: Misleading... Was a repackaged phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone backscreen was not officially Samsung, which I found out when I went to replace the battery. Even with a replaced, new battery the phone was still draining battery super quickly. Currently, the battery lasts less than a day, which compared to the last refurbished S9 I got, would have lasted a day and a half at the very least.
customer_reviews.author: A. W.

customer_reviews.title: Converted to Android
customer_reviews.text: The phone was pairable with Sprint just like the description said. Setting up and syncing the phone with my old Apple's phone took only 30 minutes. It did take a month to figure out how to set the android how I wanted it to, but it works amazing, is more customizable, is able to multitask various app windows, and has had no glitches compared to my Old I phone 7. I would recommend Samsung over Apple any day, and the seller shipped the phone quickly and the packaging was in perfect shape.
customer_reviews.author: SydRose

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone
customer_reviews.text: You might could say I love this phone because I was using an Apple iphone 5s before so this is much nicer. Still I feel like this phone is really plenty for anyone. Cost me $230 and I don't have to sign on to a two year expensive phone plan. Signing on to my provider was super easy and everything about this phone has been easy. Takes ultra fine photos and is super fast internet. Really great phone.
customer_reviews.author: jeepster54

customer_reviews.title: Brand new in Sealed Box
customer_reviews.text: I just received my s9 today which I got for a great price on Prime day...also got $100 off for opening a Amazon store card. It's brand new..sealed box..charger and usb cord was wrapped in original packaging ..i had called amazon and they reassured me it was new.switched my sim card from my old cricket phone..followed directions to transfer all my info...did have to call cricket to reset my sim card and I was good to go..Will follow up if I have any problems...but $249 for this phone was a great deal
customer_reviews.author: C. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Is Dropping The Ball
customer_reviews.text: This was my 4th Samsung Galaxy phone. I bought it just before a trip to Panama. I took many, many photos while on my trip. Somehow, the phone deleted , or somehow lost all my photos. It also seemed to have a problem connecting to my network (AT&T). I was frustrated with it and sent it back. I ordered a second Galaxy S9 and it would never connect to the network. The Carrier Techs determined it was a bad phone. I've now switched to Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: bobazon

customer_reviews.title: Like-new, right..
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Purchased from Amazon Warehouse and apparently the phone was not inspected as the device was locked for use. Also, I noticed an abnormal battery drain and that's only on wifi; imagine how much worse the battery would be with a sim card and data signal. I'm giving another 3rd party a chance, and honestly I'm not really optimistic . Amazon provided me a courtesy credit which was nice; however, there's no real way of knowing if the seller is blacklisted.
customer_reviews.author: rustico sabino

customer_reviews.title: Hell no
customer_reviews.text: It was ok for the first week, but then on phone everyone was telling me I was muffled and very choppy. Messages were not going out or in. Overall calling and texting doesnt work, whats the point of a phone then? This is especially terrible for me because I come off super unprofessional to clients, superiors and colleagues all who rely on me to be in touch and available at all times, which I have not been because of this garbage phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best thing about this phone: Samsung Pay!
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this phone, or any latest Samsung phones, is that you can use the Samsung Pay at most of the places where you need to pay across the country! I just had a 45-day around the country road trip, like 99% of the time the Samsung Pay worked(except the gas stations), so I just kept a Costco credit card in my car for gas and didn't need to carry the wallet with me anymore. But sadly the newer model Samsung Galaxy S10 e moved the fingerprint sensor to the side power button, which makes that sensor much less responsive and hard to use. keep your S9!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Y.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Love this phone!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy a warehouse deal due to the price. I can't even tell it was "very good" condition. Looks brand new. Works perfectly. Battery life great. Picture quality is stunning. I can't find one complaint at all.
customer_reviews.author: Supastar808

customer_reviews.title: Can't fast charge. Difficult to connect for slow charge.
customer_reviews.text: Bought Samsung S9 in late 2018. After about 6 months, I could not fast charge the battery. Even for the slow charge it is difficult to make a connection. It is also impossible to connect the phone to a computer. I tried different wires without success. I am using a wireless charging pad now. Very frustrating. Looks like this is a rather common problem with this Samsung product. Samsung should offer a recall or a free fixing.
customer_reviews.author: bluespunky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Phone
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order after seeing all the negative reviews but everything is good. Phone arrived new and sealed in box. Inserted my Xfinity mobile sim and it was up and running. Transferred all of my old info from old phone using the Samsung Switch app. If I had any complaints it would be battery life. Not the worst but not the best. I ordered 2 wireless chargers so the phone can easily be charged at home or on my desk at work. Speaker phone quality is fantastic. Camera is one of the better ones I've used. Overall very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: a really great high-end phone, i love how clear it captures pictures in bright or in dark areas thanks to the Dual Aperture, the most important thing for me in a smartphone is its display quality which this gets right with its gorgeous display sound is also very good on the studio speakers
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Better battery life than my S7 international.
customer_reviews.text: I'm moving from an S7 international 8 core to the S9 and so far I'm impressed. Since new, the S7 had to be on mid battery saver to finish a work day at 80%. The S9 is not on any limiter and I'm getting to leave at 40-50% most days. Screens are comparable, data is 2x as responsive. Bixby sucks. Samsung needs to be rid of it. Fitbit still doesn't like to sync with Samsung devices. But otherwise I'm extremely happy with the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is very good. Second day using the device. The charge has lasted all day. Unplugged the phone around 5:30 AM and now it is 12 AM. No charging in between. I wasn't using the device much at all between 6:30 am to 2:30 pm. After that, pretty much non-stop use, at 30% battery right now. Once a day charging is very nice. The fingerprint scanner is on the back. It picks up on your fingerprint pretty easily. Faster than my previous s7 edge so far. If I could go back in time, I can say I'll purchase this exact phone the exact way.
customer_reviews.author: Zachariah

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: It's a Samsung what more do I need to say...I did purchase an otterbox to protect it and the diamond glass covering as well. Protecting it is must as it seems very easy to break and is very slippery without a case. The features of the S9 are good. I haven't used them all and probably won't. Lol I bought it last Nov of 2018 during black friday and got a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Susan F

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really into always buying the latest and greatest tech, which is why I bought the S9 at a decent discount as the S10 has been recently released. I replaced my S6 active with this S9 and I am very impressed. The S9 performs well with daily task. With 1 charge, I usually have around 30% battery at the end of the day with moderate use. I've had the S9 for about 3 month now with 0 issues and I dont regret my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbybeb

customer_reviews.title: Buy new from Amazon, not some other shady sellers on here
customer_reviews.text: Got scared when I was reading the reviews after I already bought this because people were saying they only got a box, or the phone stopped working, or stuff was missing. But I am assuming these were all purchased from other sellers or refurbished or used. Amazon has all reviews from different sellers lumped into one. Got mine new from Amazon.com Services Inc. seller and it came with everything, including fast charger box and cable and headphones. Phone has been working excellent, great battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good battery
customer_reviews.text: Not much of an upgrade from the S8 but I'm happy with the location of the fingerprint sensor.
customer_reviews.author: J. Craw

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews I was really hesitant to buy this phone. I finally decided to give it the go ahead, and am very pleased. Phone arrived with no defects or scratches, activated it on MetroPCS with no problems. Definitely 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Njohnson

customer_reviews.title: Phone not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Phone was advertised as waterproof but I went in water for the first time with it yesterday and it completely stopped working. I think this is more a Samsung issue but I did buy it through Amazon. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Manus A.

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This unit apparently is not packaged with a SIM card or a removal tool. Since it is unlocked, you can just move your present card over and it starts right up. I had a removal tool left in the box for my old phone. This phone looks and feels great! I don't have experience yet with its features and operations but maybe I can speak for that later.
customer_reviews.author: stan p.

customer_reviews.title: Extraordinary!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutley love this phone! My husband bought it and gave it to me as a gift and I am extremely grateful for it! The camera is hands-down extraordinary! Crisp, clear, gorgeous images! The speakers are crisp, the head phones are clear and have good bass ability! The internal ability of the phone is on par with expectations. Quick response touch screen and fingerprint sensor, allows for pleasant and accurate performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jessika S.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Tracfone
customer_reviews.text: So far I am impressed with this phone's features and screen quality. I had no problems using it in the Tracfone BYOP program and was able to connect to the network with the best signal strength in my area (Verizon CDMA). I bought the Tracfone sim kit on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: LAZY348

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: Unlocked US version, as per description. Works flawlessly with Mint. Battery is long-lasting, fingerprint reader is great (works well even through a thick case, can be used to secure investing and banking apps), phone is fast, good storage, has a microSD slot. I would've loved an unlocked bootloader and replaceable battery, but most folks don't care about that so I'll give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: May not work on Verizon
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 2 phones from this listing, and while the first phone worked, the second phone was not unlocked and could not be connected to the Verizon network. The phone I received was for sprint, despite several comments saying their phone worked on Verizon. On top of that, if you do order from Kanga and get the wrong phone, they will charge a 20% restocking fee. I would avoid this listing and search elsewhere, not worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during Amazon's 2 day July sale & I love it. I have the samsung galaxy 8 plus and it was too large for my hand along with other issues (i.e. camera stopped working, apps - life360, ring, etc. did not work correctly). I used the Samsung Smartswitch & transferred everything over to my new S9. All I had to do was take it & have the sim card moved over for it to work perfectly with my cell number.
customer_reviews.author: Nickie V

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: When I received this phone, I simply popped my Verizon SIM card in and all my apps, contacts, etc downloaded to the phone from my backed up old S6. Of course the S10 came out right after this purchase but I never like to be on the bleeding edge of phone technology.
customer_reviews.author: TCB47

customer_reviews.title: Check the model number when you get the phone
customer_reviews.text: When you receive this product, make sure you get the model you bought. I ended up with the SM-9600 which is apparently the model for China and Latin America. Unfortunately, I did not realize this until after the return deadline. Phone works just have had some irritation interactions with my phone carrier because of this mix-up
customer_reviews.author: KBCR

customer_reviews.title: Lemon
customer_reviews.text: Drops connection all the time. Autocorrect changes text all the time and does not remember words I use all the time, I.e. get comes out Getty, and comes out Ann’s, etc. I spend more time correcting my text than texting. Takes great pictures! This is my fourth Samsung but this one has been quite a disappointment. I think I just got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: jess moore

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Phone arrived in full working order, with the model in description. Tested good on AT&T network (although I did have to have customer service reset the SIM and program it appropriately - keep this in mind if your mobile data doesn't work right away - the stores don't always do what they should) Very happy with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy2255

customer_reviews.title: 1 year in, phone still works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: hasnt slowed down one bit, I do software updates but I don't update apps until they just dont work anymore. Picture quality still perfect, wifi signal works fine, SIM card works fine in EU and US (it connects to T-Mobile in US, and LEBARA in London, and I think it was Orange in other countries in europe)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great Value if New Phones are out of price range
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Samsung S5 which was a decent phone minus the camera and some features lacking. Did me well for 4 years but I got this new S9 on Prime Day for a very deep discount and I am happy with it. I got it for almost half the retail price and it was new. All original packaging so it was true to it's advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Z Brown

customer_reviews.title: is it a brand new? it was unsealed and just taped .
customer_reviews.text: I am suspecting it is used. because I noticed that all of the new galaxy 9 are sealed after watching youtube. but mine wasn't sealed and just taped around the box with 3m tape. I am so disappointed. and also the instruction papers or guide books weren't wrapped with vinyl. I paid more than 500 dollars for the new product not for used one. please feed back!
customer_reviews.author: sanghee lee

customer_reviews.title: Don't know much
customer_reviews.text: I don't use finger print reader or face recognition, but the second day I had the phone I had to charge it three times, all though I did use it a lot that day to download apps and set the phone up. Sprint would have done that for me but my last phone crashed and they could not recover anything but my contacts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I HATE this phone
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst phone I've ever owned in my life. I HATE it. I want to BURN it. This phone hardly ever reads my fingerprint, the battery dies every 4 hours. And it does this new thing where everytime the screen times out the phone completely turns off. I will NEVERRRR buy a phone from Amazon again, first and last time.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M.

customer_reviews.title: expensive paper weight
customer_reviews.text: Phone worked fine for about a month, then it started failing to give me notifications for my Ring Door Bell app, and my Blink home security app. I've gone thru samsung support, and amazon support, and it still does not work. Hopefully there is some kind of warranty on it. NOT happy.
customer_reviews.author: Aliceiam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: I had heard about the camera quality of this mobile and that led me to purchase. It has a pretty good pic quality specially in evening/night when the light is low. The battery also seems to have improved from previous gen. It lasts me 1 day with 2 hrs talktime, 2 hours of audio and regular usage. Wireless charging is added plus
customer_reviews.author: an_sush

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as the S8
customer_reviews.text: This phone is stress,the battery doesn't last long and I've only had it for a month.Updates samsung sends doesn't even make a difference since they're supposed to be patches to help with battery drain from poorly written software.The phone freezes and if you commute in a city and use the trains,you'll have to keep restarting it to get a signal when you come onto the street.The phone gives a quarter of the performance the S8 could,the only difference in this one is the haptic sound and surround sound effect you get when playing music or videos.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone....
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the S5 to the S9, what a difference! This phone is really fast, great camera, speakers, screen, it goes on and on. I wasn't too sure about buying an unlocked phone on Amazon, but Amazon was the seller which set my mind at ease if there was an issue. I paired my phone with a RhinoShield case and an amFilm glass screen protector, very happy with both. Great phone! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR SPECTRUM MOBILE
customer_reviews.text: I cannot speak to the quality of the phone, but I ordered these to switch to Spectrum Mobile and they DO NOT accept "wholesale" phones. These will not work on their service as of now (July 2019) so don't waste your time! Luckily I can return the phone since I never even got to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Hayfab

customer_reviews.title: You never know what you'll get
customer_reviews.text: Received "midnight black S9 used-like new" today and opened phone with all items in the box. Phone seems to be ok for now but will have to see after a fee days if it works with no defects. I was surprized to see the earphones came damaged. Looked as if one earpiece was chewed on by a pet. I am requesting a refund or a replacement for them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AKG earbuds don't work well
customer_reviews.text: The phone is nice, easy to grip, pretty, and the camera quality is good. I'm satisfied with the phone itself, it's just the earbuds that come with it are faulty. The controls on it are unresponsive and it buzzes and causes the phone to act buggy. I would return it but that's a lot of hassle for just some earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Warranty issues
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone from Amazon in September of 2018 and my speaker went out 6 months later. It's suppose to have a US warranty but apparently Amazon shipped me a Caribbean phone and Amazon says I have had the phone to long for them to do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: camarokid

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Camera quality is too good love this and its features as well.
customer_reviews.author: Subarna

customer_reviews.title: Super good android phone
customer_reviews.text: Love my phone. Takes grate pictures and you get everything you asked for.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bhatt

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning all the things this phone does. Switching up from an S2 was quite an awakening. I have apps to discover and am sometimes confused if it is the phone itself that is doing something or an app on it. Sometimes I wish that Bixby would go on vacation, but I have no regrets in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: ITS ok....
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from my s7 edge to this its a little bit smaller than my previous and the battery doesnt last as long. I kinda prefer the convenience of actually having a home button but I'll just have to get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky Trouble22

customer_reviews.title: Quality phone.
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable phone. I loved my samsung s8. So when it was time to upgrade I bought another samsung. Definitely more powerful phone. Amazing camera both front and rear facing. Dual front speakers are an awesome feature. Very happy with this phone. Lighter than the s8 same screen size I believe though.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Sommerfeldt-Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok phone..
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts for around 12 hrs by normal use. Screen size,display is good. But it keeps hanging in between. And takes longer to open some apps. It's been only 2 months now. The Bixby thing is OK. But sometimes it won't respond. It takes so much patience for the QR code to be scanned. Mostly it won't scan the QR code. Camera is good. Previous phone was Redmi which had much battery life and speed with double amount of apps installed
customer_reviews.author: Go Green

customer_reviews.title: Great processing speed
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say that this phone has one feature. when the fingers are taken to the screen and when the phone is in the hands, the radiation is felt and the fingers of the hands start to hurt including the fingertips, this happens at any screen brightness. I do not know who else has encountered such a problem or not?
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Setting up was a little tedious
customer_reviews.text: Setting up was a little tedious, but overall it’s a very good buy , it’s going to take some time for my wife to get accustomed to it , she has had an I-phone for years and was a little concerned about switching , but she’s slowly coming around
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is great! Very easy to use and figure out where to find the settings. It was very easy to activate with my Verizon SIM card and isn't loaded with all those useless apps that "locked" phones come with.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Kowalik

customer_reviews.title: Battery "expanded" in less than a year!
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy a Samsung phone again. My son had the Samsung Galaxy S10 for just under a year when the battery suddenly expanded and cracked the back of the phone casing. He had a pretty sturdy cover on it so he didn't even realize this until the battery went from 100% charged to no charge in minutes. When he took the case off, that's when we noticed that the phone was hot and the back had cracked and separated from the front panel.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and responsive.
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, works well . Do not like Bixby because the switch is too close to volumn down control. I regret buying it unlocked because a phone store would have help.o ed with some features.
customer_reviews.author: H. F. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Great, but bad battery
customer_reviews.text: The phone per se is one of the devices I've liked the most! Fingerprint scanner at the back is so great, for me. Screen is smooth and very precise when touching it. Camera is great, if you know how to take photos A great phone overall. But, my phone specifically, stated giving me battery problems 6 months more or less after buying it. Once it hits %30 it's a matter of minutes before it goes dead
customer_reviews.author: Jose Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in my mail quickly and is working properly!
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping and phone mert expectations. The phone came quick and i am actually typing this review using it. It works smoothly and so far is keeping up with me.
customer_reviews.author: Capharnamie

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I gave a 5 star but I ended up giving to my daughter. Not techie (meaning the user ME did not know enough about the different uses of the phone) sorry I went back to Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Annemarie

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: I got it around $500 and it will hold up very well until I want to upgrade. I recommend removing some bloatware.
customer_reviews.author: Sif

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use it
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it after not being able to set up the phone. The previous owner had locked it to their email and there was no way to clear the phone without entering the email address. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Allyce

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: Second Samsung phone... first one still works and my son uses it.. was too good a deal to pass up on Prime day... tired of having to do things the Apple way... ditch the iPhone
customer_reviews.author: RCRfan

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Phone seems to work perfectly fine although amazon didnt put any bubble wrap in the box so there was nothing keeping it from getting slammed around im lucky it wasnt damaged love the fast unlock with finger print sensor samsungs website doesnt recognize the IMEI to register though nor did metro pcs's website for activating it had to call customer service to get it to go through
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: I have about 2 weeks with it already, make sure the seller is Amazon and not a third party. Came with the original package. I will update my review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Santos

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Fingerprint reader only recognized my fingerprint for a day or so, then messes up. But I dont really care. Love the phone otherwise. I've had it almost a year and wouldn't trade it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: No issues thus far except for finding a suitable screen protector that stays on :-)
customer_reviews.author: Stefan J. Newallo

customer_reviews.title: THERE IS NO PHONE INSIDE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is crazy only a charger and an empty box wtf!! Package was open I am very disappointed!!! Never thought i would have this issue
customer_reviews.author: Nelly sezer

customer_reviews.title: Best ugrade i have done in years.
customer_reviews.text: I had the s5, then the s6, then the s7, went back to the s5. Wasnt impressed with the s6 or s7. The s9 is a totally different matter. Very nice and improved platform. Havent found a thing I am not happy with . Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product has water damage
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it but had problem with the sound system. I can't hear people clearly unless i put them on speaker which ofcourse is not possible all the time. So the internal speaker has to be cleaned out by a professional which ofcourse is another expense. Also please tell your customers the full extent of the phone on its description because you left that "Has water damage" part on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mekdes

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Samsung
customer_reviews.text: 1 day 100 usd promo was brilliant. 1 month wait time was a gating but the product has been shipped right after purchase. In other circumstances, I would not become a Samsung customer.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Martynenko

customer_reviews.title: Happy happy Joy joy
customer_reviews.text: For a 2020 refurbished phone, excellent! No scratch, working great. Nice gadget upgrade on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Gone_i

product_meta.title: Samsung Galaxy S9 G960U 64GB Unlocked GSM 4G LTE Phone w/ 12MP Camera - Midnight Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Size:64 GB| Style:S9| Pattern Name:SingleIntroducing the revolutionary Galaxy S9. The phone that reimagines the camera. And in doing so reimagines everything you can do, too.
feature_bullets: Super Speed Dual Pixel Camera; Music Play Time: AOD off: Up to 90 hours, AOD on: Up to 51 hours
Infinity Display: edge to edge immersive screen, enhancing your entertainment experience
IP68 rating: withstands splashes, spills, and rain so it can take a dip, worry free
Battery: AOD off: Up to 326 hours (13.6 days), AOD on: Up to 82 hours (3.5 days)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,608 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Samsung Galaxy S9, Wall/USB Charger, Micro USB Connector, Stereo Headset, USB Connector, Quick Reference Guide, Terms and Conditions, Smart Switch Insert, SIM Ejector
